result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E. Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $400.00 from both Waushara Co Case Nos. 2016CM000139 and 2016CM000272 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs in the amount of $143.00 is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Court defers to the rules of the Huber Program as to release for any medical appointments - solely at the discretion of the jail rules and policies of the Huber Program.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian E. Petersen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CM-139 and 16CM-272 - Both Cases Called @ 11:05 AM: Defendant Brian E. Petersen in court with attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present and declines any statement.  16CM-139 Plea Battery w/Dom Enh: NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  16CM-272 DRI.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  Def confirms his rejection of probation.  The Court:  Imposes 90 Days WCJ with Huber, GT and 2 days TS credit - Report 9/1/2016 at 8:00 PM; Court Costs with DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Both Bonds to be applied to Costs imposed in 16CM-139.  Jail rules will apply to any medical appointments Def may have - solely the decision of the WCJ and court defers to WCJ.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 30, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Case called @ 2:52 p.m. Defendant Brian E. Petersen in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader - offer has been extended to the defendant - unsure if the defendant is wishing to proceed. Statement by DE - is taking medication for a medical condition and does not feel that he is able to proceed at this time without counsel.  The Court questions the DE. The Court will grant the DE's request and will adjourn the case to allow the defendant to obtain an attorney.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 11:45 am.
from DE requesting clarification of bond - the Court will address at the next hearing

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:19 PM: Defendant Brian E. Petersen in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel and requests to speak with the State on resolution.   NGP entered by Court.  ADA argues for cash bond w/conditions.   PTC and P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
